name: Difference of GCDs
statement: You are given three integers $$$n$$$, $$$l$$$, and $$$r$$$. You need to construct an array $$$a_1,a_2,\dots,a_n$$$ ($$$l\le a_i\le r$$$) such that $$$\gcd(i,a_i)$$$ are all distinct or report there's no solution. Here $$$\gcd(x, y)$$$ denotes the greatest common divisor (GCD) of integers $$$x$$$ and $$$y$$$.
inputFormat: The input consists of multiple test cases. The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1\le t\le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows. The first line contains three integers $$$n$$$, $$$l$$$, $$$r$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^5$$$, $$$1\le l\le r\le 10^9$$$). It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^5$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case, if there is no solution, print " NO " (without quotes). You can print letters in any case (upper or lower). Otherwise, print " YES " (without quotes). In the next line, print $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1,a_2,\ldots,a_n$$$ — the array you construct. If there are multiple solutions, you may output any.
